instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP1V1_SLPS2R: What is PP1V1_SLPS2R? The PP1V1_SLPS2R power rail in the MacBook schematic provides a 1.1-volt supply in a specific low-power state indicated by the "_SLPS2R" suffix and is used for powering the T2 chip..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a12179 no power
threads.message:
board clean no sign water corrosion
restored iconfigurator ok (no errors)
i dont see any short 
SLPS2R and AWAKE voltage are present
voltages from <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>  is ok but just wondering 
l7030 when i connect the charger got 12v slowly decrease the voltage from 5v
got 20v 0.20amp without battery
replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40 also <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a12179 no power
threads.message:
I can't remember how many times I repeated on the forum; STOP checking L7030 on new machines.

What problem has your board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a12179 no power
threads.message:
ohh sorry :giggle:
the board unable to turn on with no sign of corrosion or any shortcircuit 
i also tried flash the t2rom using t2unlock.bin and restore all is ok 
but still unable to turn on. 
board freeze at 20v .22amp.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a12179 no power
threads.message:
What voltages do you get on the coils?
At least G3S should be present.

Did you test the board alone on the desk?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a12179 no power
threads.message:
board alone
ppbus 12.6v
l9060 2.5v
l7670 5v
l7690 3.3v
l7210/20/30 l7400 0v 
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S</SIGNAL> 1.8v

<CHIP>U7800</CHIP> voltages
<SIGNAL>PPVDDCPU_AWAKE</SIGNAL> .5v
<SIGNAL>PP0V82_SLPDDR</SIGNAL> .8v
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> 1.1v
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SLPDDR</SIGNAL> .9v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> 1.8v
<SIGNAL>PPVNN_PCH_EXT_REG</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_PCH_EXT_REG</SIGNAL> 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a12179 no power
threads.message:
Some boards require good battery to turn on.
So get known good battery and try again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a12179 no power
threads.message:
i think battery and charging are working fine.
when battery is connected i can feel the taptic on the trackpad
also the usb meter current is high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a12179 no power
threads.message: anyway i tried put good working battery still no able to turn on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a12179 no power
threads.message:
Check voltage at L7400, L7701, L7820/21, L8100/50.
Inspect J6100, and RIO flex/board for corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a12179 no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a12179 no power
threads.message:
"L7701 0V shorted"
What is exact ohm resistance of that short?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a12179 no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a12179 no power
threads.message:
40 ohm can be good; should compare with other board.

"Inspect J6100, and RIO flex/board for corrosion."
???
